text:
First thing’s first: Terms like “natural” and “organic” are not regulated by the FDA, which means that big ol’ “natural” stamp on your sunscreen label is pretty much meaningless. So how do you know what’s actually natural or organic when it comes to sunscreen? You need to flip the bottle over and read the label.

But because I know you don’t have time to be scouring different ingredient lists while quickly running to the drugstore, I’ve rounded up my 12 favorite natural and organic sunscreens that really, truly are what they say they are. They are all chemical-free, mineral-based formulas (so they use zinc and/or titanium dioxide to protect your skin), and made with good-for-you plant-based ingredients too. Find your new formula, below, and get slathering.
